title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8188-5.2 - Duties of real property appraisers
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8188-5.2 - Duties of real property appraisers

State Regulations

An appraisal of real estate is an estimate of the value of
real estate as of a specified date in the form of a written report which
presents factual and other relevant data and the analyses of such data which
support the estimate. Professional appraisal duties are the services leading to
estimates of value performed by persons who devote their time largely or
exclusively to real estate appraisal work for which they are well qualified by
training and experience. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
§§
8188-5.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
